p: The cost estimates extracted from the current study allow for a comparison with recent similar estimates in Southern Europe. According to our findings the costs of public mosquito control programs range from approximately 0.6 € to 0.9 € per household in Athens, while the public costs of informed arbovirus plans in the Region of Emilia Romagna in Italy reach almost 1.2 € per household [ 36]. Using the Purchasing Power Parity Index [ 41] this figure translates to an equivalent of 1.04 €/year per household in Athens, indicating that a small per capita increase in public costs could justify the design and implementation of more targeted programs in Greece, in terms of perceived citizens’ benefits levels as already presented in the current analysis.
